Liverpool tapping-up row intensifies with Stoke chairman also seeking compensation, writes @JPercyTelegraph

Carragher: "I think Liverpool have got the sixth-best squad in the league so to be in the top four would be a very good season."

Carragher: "It’s very difficult; Liverpool don’t have the revenue to compete with the others, it will be a building process."

Carragher: "If Liverpool can get into the top four for three or four years on the bounce, then that would be a major achievement."

Carragher: "You cement your position in there and then maybe think, ‘OK, let’s go for the title’."

Carragher: "Klopp signed a 5/6 year contract. I’m sure each year he’d be looking for progression, 2/3 years they will have a great chance."

Carragher: "But you can have plans - other teams have. I think with Klopp it’s more of a building process than just splashing the cash."

NEW: Liverpool ‘have 69% chance of top four finish’
http://www.thisisanfield.com/2017/04/liverpool-69-chance-top-four-finish/
According to the Euro Club Index, Liverpool remain on course to finish in the top four – with a 69 percent chance of finishing in the all-important Champions League qualifying places.

Chelsea are, statistically, 100% guaranteed, while Spurs are now 99% secure thanks to their dramatic comeback at Swansea.

Man City are now third favourites, with 79% chance.

Arsenal are fifth with 36%, and United back in sixth on 18%.
